title: Change snowfall effect color to blue

requirements.text: Modify the SnowfallBackground component's drawSnowflake function in frontend/src/components/SnowfallBackground.tsx to render snowflakes in blue tones instead of red by changing the radial gradient color stops from red values (rgba(255, 0, 0, ...) and rgba(255, 100, 100, ...)) to blue values (e.g., rgba(173, 216, 230, ...) for light blue center and rgba(135, 206, 250, ...) for sky blue outer glow)

quotes: change the snow efefct to blue

acceptanceCriteria: The drawSnowflake function uses blue rgba values in the radial gradient instead of red
Snowflakes render with a soft blue glow effect on the canvas
The color change applies to all gradient color stops (center and outer glow)
Animation speed, particle behavior, and accessibility features remain unchanged

constraints: Do not modify the animation speed, particle density, or drift behavior of snowflakes
Preserve all existing performance optimizations (devicePixelRatio scaling, resize handling, density caps)
Maintain prefers-reduced-motion support and accessibility patterns
Only modify the gradient color values in the drawSnowflake function
nonGoals: Changing the background animation type (remain as snowfall, not rain or hail)
Modifying particle size, speed, or movement patterns
Adding new particle effects or animation behaviors
Changing theme colors or other UI elements beyond the snowfall effect
